newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: Singapore shares seen steady in lacklustre mood.
newsitem.headline: Singapore shares seen steady in lacklustre mood.

text.p: Singapore shares were seen steady early Friday but in a lacklustre mood as investors stayed cautious due to bearish technicals and lack of incentives.
"It's quite difficult to recommend anything as there is just as much interest to buy selected stocks as there is to sell others," a local bank dealer said.
He said electronics and property stocks could draw better interest after stronger April non-oil export figures and firm prices in a recent government land tender for executive condominiums.
There could also be more follow-through upward momentum on the broader market if sentiment in Malaysia remained firm.
On Thursday, the Sraits Times Industrials Index closed at 2,061.71, up by 7.72 points. It brushed an intraday high of 2,073.28 points.
Market volume was 210.22 million shares with gainers ahead of losers by 225 to 152.
